1.brief: properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

2.brief: to come in contact with, whether by accident or violence; figuratively, to concur
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

3.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, to urge; by implication, to inflict apenalty, specifically, to fine

4.brief: a heel, i.e. (figuratively) the last of anything (used adverbially, for ever); also result, i.e. compensation; and so (adverb with preposition or relatively) on account of
condescension, human and subjective (modesty), or divine and objective (clemency)
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

5.brief: a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)

6.brief: properly, to narrow; figuratively, to initiate or discipline
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

7.brief: properly, to twine, i.e. (by implication) to unite, to remain; also to borrow (as a form of obligation) or (caus.) to lend
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, to twine, i.e. (by implication) to unite, to remain; also to borrow (as a form of obligation) or (caus.) to lend

8.brief: to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

9.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin

10.brief: to drive out from a possession; especially to expatriate or divorce
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife

11.brief: to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

12.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
properly, to wrench, i.e. (figuratively) to subvert
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage

13.brief: properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area
properly, to dash in pieces, i.e. kill (a human being), especially to murder

14.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
properly, to foam at the mouth, i.e. to be enraged
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

15.brief: to tie, physically (gird, confine, compact) or mentally (in love, league)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

16.brief: to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

17.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to place (in a very wide application)

18.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
delightful (objective or subjective, literal or figurative)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

19.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

20.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
trebly, i.e. (in time) day before yesterday

21.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)

22.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)
an opening, i.e. door or gate

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

24.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

25.brief: properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
hence, to learn (and causatively to teach)
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

26.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange)

27.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

28.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application

29.brief: to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
